intro: Lannea zenkeri, commonly known as the African starwood, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its thick, fissured bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by oval, woody fruits containing several seeds. It is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Lannea zenkeri is valued for its hard, heavy wood and is used in traditional medicine and as a source of timber.
